You can create an IchimokuKinkoHyo indicator object that is not bounded to any automatic update and choose which data it should use. To use it, please refer to the reference table below.

IchimokuKinkoHyo()1/1

            IchimokuKinkoHyo QuantConnect.Indicators.IchimokuKinkoHyo (
    *string                       name,
    Int32                        tenkanPeriod,
    Int32                        kijunPeriod,
    Int32                        senkouAPeriod,
    Int32                        senkouBPeriod,
    Int32                        senkouADelayPeriod,
    Int32                        senkouBDelayPeriod,
    *Nullable<Resolution>  resolution
   )

Creates a new IchimokuKinkoHyo indicator for the name. The indicator will be automatically updated on the given resolution.

Parameters
*string name (Optional) The custom name of the indicator whose ICHIMOKU we want.
Int32 tenkanPeriod The period to calculate the Tenkan-sen period.
Int32 kijunPeriod The period to calculate the Kijun-sen period.
Int32 senkouAPeriod The period to calculate the Tenkan-sen period.
Int32 senkouBPeriod The period to calculate the Tenkan-sen period.
Int32 senkouADelayPeriod The period to calculate the Tenkan-sen period.
Int32 senkouBDelayPeriod The period to calculate the Tenkan-sen period.
*Nullable<Resolution> resolution (Optional) The resolution.

Return

IchimokuKinkoHyo - A new IchimokuKinkoHyo indicator with the specified periods and delays

Definition at file Indicators/IchimokuKinkoHyo.cs.


You can use two methods to update the indicator: automatic or manual.

Automatic Update

In this method, you will recreate the basic indicator usage: create the indicator with its constructor and register the indicator for automatic updates with the RegisterIndicator() method, but could be using a custom resolution via a Consolidator.

private IchimokuKinkoHyo _ichimoku;
// In Initialize()
_ichimoku = new IchimokuKinkoHyo(tenkanPeriod, kijunPeriod, senkouAPeriod, senkouBPeriod, senkouADelayPeriod, senkouBDelayPeriod);
_ichimoku.Updated += IndicatorUpdateMethod;

var thirtyMinuteConsolidator = new TradeBarConsolidator(TimeSpan.FromMinutes(30));
SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

RegisterIndicator(symbol, _ichimoku, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

// In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if (_ichimoku.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _ichimoku.Current.Value;
}
# In Initialize()
self.ichimoku = IchimokuKinkoHyo(tenkanPeriod, kijunPeriod, senkouAPeriod, senkouBPeriod, senkouADelayPeriod, senkouBDelayPeriod)
self.ichimoku.Updated += self.IndicatorUpdateMethod

thirty_minute_consolidator = TradeBarConsolidator(timedelta(minutes=30))
self.SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirty_minute_consolidator)

self.RegisterIndicator(symbol, self.ichimoku, thirty_minute_consolidator)

# In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if self.ichimoku.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.ichimoku.Current.Value

Manual Update

Updating your indicator manually allows you to control which data is used and create indicators of other non-regular price fields. The indicator objects have the Update() method that updates the state of the IchimokuKinkoHyo indicator with the given a trade bar, a quote bar, or a custom data bar.

With this method, the indicator will only be ready after the Update() method has been used to pump enough data.

private IchimokuKinkoHyo _ichimoku;
// In Initialize()
_ichimoku = new IchimokuKinkoHyo(tenkanPeriod, kijunPeriod, senkouAPeriod, senkouBPeriod, senkouADelayPeriod, senkouBDelayPeriod);

// In OnData()
if (data.QuoteBars.ContainsKey(symbol))
{
    _ichimoku.Update(data.QuoteBars[symbol]);
}
if (_ichimoku.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _ichimoku.Current.Value;
}
# In Initialize()
self.ichimoku = IchimokuKinkoHyo(tenkanPeriod, kijunPeriod, senkouAPeriod, senkouBPeriod, senkouADelayPeriod, senkouBDelayPeriod)

# In OnData()
if data.QuoteBars.ContainsKey(symbol):
    self.ichimoku.Update(data.QuoteBars[symbol])
if self.ichimoku.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.ichimoku.Current.Value
